page.title: 01LIMERIGG A GENERAL ACCOUNT
page.content: The area studied,grid.ref.02840669 is partly in Central Region and partly in Strathclyde. Limerigg village belongs to Central Region and has a population of 228. It is however,an area of high unemployment. Most of those lucky enough to be in employment are either working for one of the local family businesses or commute to Airdrie, Falkirk or Grangemouth. The unpopulated area is mainly used as grazing land for beef cattle. The area is very exposed to rain and wind,plus both topsoil and subsoil are poor, thus it is unsuitable for the growing and ripening of crops,other than for fodder. The forestry commission has planted trees in two sections but there does not appear to be any plans for expansion.
